flawed_nl_solution:
His smaller truck is 8000*0.3=<<8000*0.3=2400>>2400 gallons smaller
So it can transport 8000-2400=<<8000-2400=5600>>5600 gallons
There are 6-2-1=<<6-2-1=3>>3 of the very large trucks
Those trucks are each 8000*0.5=<<8000*0.5=4000>>4000 gallons larger
So they can transport 8000+4000=<<8000+4000=21000>>21000 gallons
So in total they transport 3*21000=<<3*21000=63000>>63000
The 8000-gallon trucks can transport 8000*2=<<8000*2=16000>>16000 gallons
So in total he can transport 5600+16000+63000=<<5600+16000+63000=84600>>84600 gallons
#### 84600

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 12000, not 21000. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
